summary: Interactive romantic Valentine web page (HTML/CSS/JS) with Yes/No buttons where No evades hover and Yes reveals a meme image message; designed to run on iPad Chrome.
architectural_notes: Single-page interactive HTML/CSS/JS design intended to run locally in Chrome on iPad.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Meme-style romantic image with bold readable text “Good choice”, pink/white palette, heart accents (valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_1024x1024.png)

existing_features.title: Create a single-page romantic Valentine UI that asks the question “Will you be my Valentine?” and presents exactly two prominent options: “Yes” and “No”, using a pink-and-white romantic theme suitable for iPad Chrome.
Implement interactive behavior where the “No” button moves to a different position whenever the user tries to interact with it (e.g., hover/pointer enter), making it effectively unclickable.
Add a touch-friendly fallback so that on touch devices (iPad), attempting to tap the “No” button causes it to move away before a click can be completed.
When the user clicks “Yes”, replace the initial prompt with a celebratory view that displays a meme image and the message “Good choice”.
Add the required generated image asset(s) under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them from the frontend (do not fetch images from the backend).

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a simple romantic-themed Valentine web page (pink/white) asking 'Will you be my Valentine?' that runs in iPad Chrome using HTML/CSS/JS.
Add Yes/No options where the No button moves away on hover to prevent clicking.
On Yes click, display a meme image with the message 'Good choice'.

projectName: Romantic Valentine prompt page with evasive No button and Yes reveal meme
